html:
Eccentricia

In classic Tricia-style, I injured myself this week and was unable to walk for 36 hours. Seriously, I can't make this stuff up. And while joking with a beloved former employee about my all too common antics, I proposed incorporating a cane into my look.

ANC Round Up: The remains of the agenda, ANC2E

As GM mentioned yesterday, Monday night’s ANC meeting was so long that GM was left with no time to write up the whole meeting in time for yesterday. So here’s what you missed:

Crime

Politics on Facebook: “Dislike”

I try to stay out of politics on Facebook. Scratch that: I tried to stay out of politics on Facebook--until the recent primaries.

ANC hears pros and cons of Tudor Place plan

The Georgetown Metropolitan sat through a 4 1/2 hour beast of an ANC meeting Monday evening.

Raccoons would benefit in Cheh bill

A raccoon is on your second-floor deck. The family cat appears to be befriending it and its three, uh...cubs(?). Your kids are afraid someone will hurt the flea-infested varmints. You are afraid the cute animals could bite your kids and pets. Who do you call?

Julia Farr’s Grand Opening

Despite a downpour and howling winds outside, nothing could dampen the mood inside Julia Farr’s eponymous boutique Thursday night.

Cheh Says Pope Should Not Return to Hardy

D.C. Councilmember Mary Cheh (D-Ward 3) said she opposes reinstating popular Hardy Middle School principal Patrick Pope at the respected D.C.

ANC takes up Tudor Place and Wisey’s

The Georgetown Metropolitan previews ANC2E's agenda for Monday evening's meeting.

Georgetown Renewal Tour Kicks Off with Shoes and Style

By the time The Georgetown Dish arrived at Everard's Saturday, bouquets of flowers poked

Georgetown Renewal Tour Launches Saturday at Everard's

There was a break in the rain, if not the clouds, Thursday. Almost as suddenly, Louie and Jennifer Everard were busy with customers. Why? Everard's is a break in the clouds. "I'm a California surfer, but I like tailored slacks," said one customer.

Salud from the Roof Terrace of the Kennedy Center

Location location location. Bar none, there’s no more spectacular, romantic, elegant, spacious venue in all of Washington from which to enjoy a glass of wine than the Roof Terrace of the Kennedy Center ...

One

As of September 2010, Luxe & Lucid is one year old. And what a year it’s been!

Gray speaks out on Hardy, GU expansion and parking

Presumptive mayor-elect Vincent Gray told The Georgetown Dish he "can't understand" why popular Hardy Middle School principal Patrick Pope was removed from the school and that as mayor he will consider Pope's assignment as part of his administrat

Georgetowners owe almost $1 million in back taxes

The District Office of Tax and Revenue auctioned off the tax liens on 2,717 properties last week (only 1,265 were actually sold).

On A Chile Day in September….

It was a gray and rainy Wednesday, as guests flocked into the Chilean Embassy on Massachusetts Avenue for a display of some of Chile’s most delicious imports. In commemoration of Chile's Bicentennial, Ambassador Arturo Fermandois hosted a series

First Look: The Georgetown Library

The fences around the Georgetown Library came down the other day, which gave GM and chance to poke around the building as it nears completion. He took a few shots, so check them out:

Up for Renewal Starts this Saturday

By age 37, Cathy Alter had made a mess of her life. With a failed marriage under her belt, she was continuing down a path of poor decisions paved with a stead stream of junk food, unpaid bills, and highly inappropriate men. So what did she truly want? A decent guy. A nicer home.

Roby Penn farewell party at Tom Quinn's

"What worries me most about this party is that Roby may have such a good time he won't leave," quipped Tom Quinn at the Saturday night farewell he hosted for bon vivant Roby Penn, who's headed back to Texas. Here's a look inside.

Did she or didn't she? Frida Burling allegedly turns 95

Frida Burling is a force of Georgetown, and a force of nature. She is a founding contributor of The Georgetown Dish and a leader of good causes. While some say she recently turned 95, others will tell you she cannot yet be 40.

Would you care if medical marijuana were sold in Georgetown?

GM touched on this the other day, but he thinks it’s worth a more substantial post: the Current reported on Wednesday that an unnamed individual is contemplating applying to open a medical ma

Retail therapy

It was quite literally the dog days of summer on Thursday evening as DC Magazine and the Washington Humane Society celebrated the grand opening of The Shops at Wisconsin Place.

Once Out-of-Work Journos Ham It Up at Party

Georgetowner Annie Groer took the buyout at The Washington Post a few years ago. The popular Reliable Source columnist has since been creating her own destiny as have many others.

To Die For - R&Y Augousti

Do you ever see something and say, “If I died and came back as a _________ (fill in the blank), I would want to be that one.” I do. Granted, I have a flair for the dramatic. But still.

Winter Slimming

A few weeks back, I discussed a new body contouring device called CoolSculpting. The CoolSculpting procedure is a non-invasive technology that is clinically proven to reduce unwanted body fat.

Georgetown temporary library to close this Saturday, new library opens Oct. 18th

This Saturday, the temporary library on M St.

Steve Gottlieb: Portrait of a Washington Photographer

Why publish three books on Washington?

Hardy students renew protests over principal

Students at Hardy Middle School attempted to stage a protest last week in the latest round of turmoil since the controversial removal of popular Hardy Principal Patrick Pope by schools chancellor Michelle Rhee. As D.C.'s likely next mayor

Here's to you, Kiki: Happy Birthday

The bar at Casa Nonna looked more like the inside of a newsroom on Tuesday night as friends of Kiki Ryan collected to wish her Happy Birthday.

Happy Birthday, Kiki!!

It was a media fest at the new Italian eatery Casa Nonna on Tuesday night as some of the best and brightest media types in DC bellied up to the bar to wish Politico Click’s Kiki Ryan a happy birthday.

View From a New Georgetown Bridge

The new Thomas Jefferson Street Bridge is an open wound of dirt, planks and heavy equipment sprawling out over the C&O Canal just south of M Street.

The way she tells it, by age 37, Cathy Alter had made a mess of her life. Newly divorced, she

About a Horse

It wasn’t a run for the roses, but more a seat at the theater that brought movie and racing fans to Georgetown Sunday afternoon for a special sneak preview of Disney’s upcoming motion picture,

Editorial: Gray, Rhee should visit Georgetown schools

Georgetown's highly-regarded schools, including Hyde-Addison Elementary and Hardy Middle School, have experienced turmoil and uncertainty in recent months.

Aiding a Cause by Design

Over 700 fashionistas and intrepid bargain hunters braved the rain and came out in droves as the eighth annual District Sample Sale took place on Thursday evening at Cady's Alley to benefit the George Washington Un

Authors Open Pandora's Box

Author and Cleveland Park resident Kate Lehrer is not afraid to open Pandora's Box.

Atwater Bakery joins Rose Park Farmers Market

With a popular following already at other neighborhood markets (not to mention it's fame in hometown Baltimore), Atwater Bakery joined an elite group of farmers at Rose Park Farmers Market Wednesday.

H&C a la Montreux

As mentioned in last week’s post, I have been in Switzerland installing a project. And as many of you know, I’ve been working a lot lately.

Morning Joe's Brzezinski Brings 24/7 Style to J.McLaughlin

How do you host an event mixing charity, high fashion, brains and fun in Washington? Call a New Yorker. Specifically, call Mika Brzezinski. The brainy, chic anchor of Morning Joe came to J.McLaughlin, the "classic with a twist"

Morocco on 15th Street

It was a day in Casablanca at the Sofitel in Lafayette Square as guests gathered at the hotel’s Ici Urban Bistro to savor the flavors of Morocco in honor of the opening of two of seven new Sofitel properties in Morocco—Casablanca and Essaouria, in 2011. Sofitel D.C.

Back to School

“How was your day, girls?” I say to Katherine and Peyton as they pile into the car after their first day back to school. They start talking in unison, their words clipping each other. “One at a time,” I say. Peyton, 13, launches into math and humanities and who’s in which class.

Fashion's Night Out Draws Georgetown Clout

Not seeming to mind the New York heritage or national reach of an event transplanted to local streets, Georgetowners mixed and mingled their way through a successful village-wide party, Fashion's Night Out, that filled sidewalks, stores and streets with residents and Georgetown business owners al

Style For Hire Launches in D.C.

/*-->*/

The Story Behind the Hyde-Addison Numbers

A couple weeks ago, the Georgetown Current reported a spike in the size of this year’s kindergarten class at the Hyde-Addison Elementary school here in Georgetown.

Anytown, a new 9/11 story, comes to theatres

“If he's listening, I just hope he understands that what he's proposing to do is completely contrary to our values of Americans” -- President Obama on Good Morning America, referring to the purported Koran/Quran burning on 9/11 by pastor Jones. Fortunately, that didn’t happen.

Capital Bikeshare to Come to Georgetown on September 20

The District’s new bikeshare system is set to roll out, so to speak, on September 20th. The original plans call for four stations to be in Georgetown: on K St.

Thank you, Lady Gaga for...TBD and Martin's

Lady Gaga performed at the Verizon Center Tuesday, much to the chagrin of bloggers who were banned from the media list despite being responsible for her meteoric rise.

Gone installing

Tricia Huntley left the Dish a note saying “I will be leaving for an installation in Switzerland” and the strange list below. The Dish assumes this means Tricia is making stunning rooms for a blessed client in Switzerland.

More about two new liquor licenses in Georgetown

At the September Georgetown ANC meeting, D.C. Alcoholic Beverage Regulation Administration head Fred Moosally announced that two licenses that had been held-in-safe-keeping were going to be issued. The Georgetown Metropolitan reports that Come To Eat going into 3222 O St.

TBD feted by The Georgetown Dish at Martin's

Over 100 Washington journalists and friends toasted Robert Allbritton’s TBD Blog Community Network and its Georgetown media partner, The Georgetown Dish, Tuesday evening at Billy Martin’s Tavern in Georgetown.

Cirque du Soliel OVO Premieres at National Harbor

The roar of the greasepaint was more like a buzz, chirp and hiss on Wednesday evening as Cirque du Soliel OVO presented its sneak preview at National Harbor.
